item.title: Outdoor Burn Ban Declared for Western Washington Tribal Reservations Starting January 1
item.description: (Seattle - December 31, 2015) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is declaring a ban on all outdoor open burning on the following Indian reservations in Washington State due to stagnant air conditions and elevated air pollution, effective at 8:00 a.m. on January 1, 2016.
item.dc:creator: Region 10

item.title: EPA Announces West Lake Landfill Isolation Barrier Decision
item.dc:creator: Region 07

item.title: Outdoor Burn Ban Declared for Yakama Nation Reservation Starting December 30
item.description: (Seattle - December 29, 2015) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is declaring a ban on all outdoor open burning on the Yakama Nation Reservation due to stagnant air conditions and elevated air pollution, effective at 8:00 a.m. on Wednesday, December 30, 2015.
item.dc:creator: Region 10

item.title: U.S. EPA announces $22 million settlement for cleanup of Cooper Drum Superfund Site in South Gate, Los Angeles County
item.description: LOS ANGELES -- The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and U.S. Department of Justice today announced that a group of 40 parties have agreed to conduct the cleanup of the Cooper Drum site in South Gate, 10 miles southeast of downtown Los Angeles.
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: Gobierno de Puerto Rico Hace Mejoras a Infraestructura de Agua en San Juan Tras Acuerdo con el Gobierno Federal
item.description: (Nueva York, NY - 23 de diciembre de 2015) En virtud de dos acuerdos con la Agencia Federal de Protección Ambiental (EPA, por sus siglas en inglés) y el Departamento de Justicia de Estados Unidos, tres agencias del Estado Libre Asociado de Puerto Rico acordaron realizar mejoras en partes de los s
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: Puerto Ricos Government to Make Major Upgrades to San Juan Water Infrastructure in Settlement with the Federal Government
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Seeks Public Input on Modified Training at Camp Edwards
item.description: EPA is seeking public comment on a proposed agreement to allow the Massachusetts Army National Guard to train with a "Percussion Activated Neutralizer" at the Camp Edwards portion of Joint Base Cape Cod.
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: EPA Announces $25 Million to Improve Water Quality, Infrastructure in Arizona
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO - The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced $25 million in funding to Arizona for investment in statewide improvements in local drinking water and wastewater infrastructure and the reduction of water pollution.
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: EPA Announces $19 Million for Drinking Water and Wastewater Infrastructure Projects in Nevada
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO -The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced more than $19 million in funding to Nevada for investments in statewide improvement in local drinking water and wastewater infrastructure and the reduction of water pollution.
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: EPA Approves Okla. Drinking Water Rule
item.description: DALLAS - (Dec. 22, 2015) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has approved the state of Oklahoma's revised rule for regulating total coliform in drinking water.
item.dc:creator: Region 06
